name: 1-(2-nitro),2-dibenzoyl-1-tert-butylhydrazine
Reason: 1-(2-nitro),2-dibenzoyl-1-tert-butylhydrazine is a complex molecule with multiple functional groups. To predict its melting point, we will consider the melting point of the basic unit, which is 1-tert-butylhydrazine, which has a melting point of 105°C. The additional functional groups in the molecule will increase the melting point: (1) The two nitro groups (N+) add approximately +30°C due to the increased polarity and dipole moment; (2) The two phenyl groups (C2ccccc2) add approximately +40°C due to the increased molecular weight and pi-pi interactions; (3) The tert-butyl group (C(C)C) adds approximately +10°C due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume; (4) The dibenzoyl group (C(C)(C)) adds approximately +20°C due to the increased molecular weight and hydrogen bonding potential. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
